articles.title: NVIDIA DGX Spark Arrives for World’s AI Developers - The Manila Times
articles.summary: This article is an interstitial Cloudflare page and does not contain the actual article content. The page indicates a security check is being performed before proceeding to the requested article. Therefore, no summary of the NVIDIA DGX Spark article can be provided.

articles.title: Top Mizuho Analyst Bumps Intel Stock (INTC) Price Target, But Says ‘Core Issues Remain’
articles.summary: Mizuho analyst Vijay Rakesh raised his price target for Intel (INTC) to $39 from $23, maintaining a Neutral rating. The increase is attributed to potential growth in Intel's advanced chip packaging and a new CPU deal with Nvidia (NVDA), which could significantly boost future revenues. However, Rakesh remains cautious, citing ongoing challenges such as market share loss in servers, an unclear AI roadmap, and potential margin pressures from reliance on TSMC (TSM) for its 18A process.

articles.title: NVIDIA DGX Spark Arrives for World’s AI Developers - NVIDIA Newsroom
articles.summary: NVIDIA announced the immediate availability of DGX Spark, the world's smallest AI supercomputer, delivered by CEO Jensen Huang to Elon Musk at SpaceX. This compact desktop system, built on the NVIDIA Grace Blackwell architecture, offers petaflop AI performance and 128GB of unified memory, enabling local development and fine-tuning of large AI models. Major partners like Acer, ASUS, Dell Technologies, and Lenovo are expanding access to DGX Spark systems to empower AI developers worldwide.

articles.title: NVIDIA DGX Spark Arrives for World’s AI Developers
articles.summary: NVIDIA announced the shipment of its DGX Spark, the world’s smallest AI supercomputer, designed to bring powerful AI computing to developers. This compact desktop system, built on the NVIDIA Grace Blackwell architecture, offers a petaflop of AI performance and 128GB of unified memory, accelerating the development of agentic and physical AI locally. NVIDIA's CEO Jensen Huang personally delivered one of the first units to Elon Musk, echoing the delivery of the first DGX-1 in 2016 which kickstarted the AI revolution.

articles.title: NVIDIA DGX Spark Arrives for World’s AI Developers - GlobeNewswire
articles.summary: NVIDIA announced the immediate shipping of NVIDIA DGX Spark, the world's smallest AI supercomputer, designed to bring powerful AI development capabilities to individual desks. Founder and CEO Jensen Huang personally delivered the first unit to Elon Musk at SpaceX, highlighting the system's role in advancing agentic and physical AI development. The DGX Spark, built on the NVIDIA Grace Blackwell architecture, offers a petaflop of AI performance and expands access to powerful AI computing through partnerships with major manufacturers.

articles.title: NVIDIA DGX Spark Arrives for World’s AI Developers - StreetInsider
articles.summary: NVIDIA has announced the immediate shipment of its new DGX Spark, which it terms the world's smallest AI supercomputer. This new system delivers a petaflop of AI performance and 128GB of unified memory in a compact desktop form factor, designed for AI development. NVIDIA CEO Jensen Huang personally delivered one of the first units to Elon Musk at SpaceX, reminiscent of the DGX-1 delivery to OpenAI in 2016.

articles.title: NVIDIA DGX Spark Arrives for World’s AI Developers - Stock Titan
articles.summary: NVIDIA has begun shipping DGX Spark, which is described as the world's smallest AI supercomputer, with orders becoming available starting October 15, 2025. This compact system offers up to 1 petaflop of AI performance and 128GB of unified memory, supporting local inference and fine-tuning of large AI models. Major OEM partners will also be selling these systems, pre-installed with the NVIDIA AI software stack for immediate developer use.

articles.title: NVIDIA DGX Spark Arrives for World’s AI Developers - Taiwan News
articles.summary: NVIDIA has announced the immediate shipping of DGX Spark, the world’s smallest AI supercomputer, designed to bring powerful AI computing to developers' desktops. This compact system delivers a petaflop of AI performance and 128GB of unified memory, enabling local inference and fine-tuning of large AI models. NVIDIA CEO Jensen Huang personally delivered the first unit to Elon Musk at SpaceX, signaling a new era for AI development similar to the launch of DGX-1.

articles.title: Why Pony AI Stock Raced to a 9% Gain Today
articles.summary: Pony AI (NASDAQ: PONY) saw its stock rise by over 9% after Jefferies analyst Johnson Wan initiated coverage with a buy recommendation. Wan highlighted Pony AI's adept navigation of regulatory landscapes and cost containment in China's rapidly growing autonomous transportation market, projected to reach $7.3 billion by 2030. Citigroup also flagged the stock for its 30-day upside catalyst watch.

articles.title: How the $381B AI Cloud Deal Is Shaping Oracle’s 2025 Valuation
articles.summary: Oracle's stock has seen significant growth in 2025 due to its push into AI cloud infrastructure, including deals with OpenAI. Despite being considered overvalued by traditional metrics like DCF and PE ratios, the company's valuation is heavily influenced by investor "Narratives" around its potential in the AI-powered cloud market, with fair value estimates ranging from $183 to $333 per share. These diverse outlooks highlight the speculative nature of Oracle's current market perception and future prospects.

articles.title: Navitas Supports 800 VDC Power Architecture for NVIDIA’s Next-Generation AI Factory Computing Platforms - The National Law Review
articles.summary: Navitas Semiconductor is supporting NVIDIA's next-generation AI factory computing platforms with its GaN (gallium nitride) and SiC (silicon carbide) power solutions. The company unveiled new 100 V GaN FETs, along with 650 V GaN and high voltage SiC devices, specifically designed for NVIDIA's 800 VDC AI factory architecture. This move addresses the need for breakthrough efficiency, power density, and performance in AI data centers, transitioning from traditional 54 V architectures to the more efficient 800 VDC distribution for megawatt-scale AI computing.

articles.title: JPMorgan says leveraged ETFs worsened Friday's Wall St selloff
articles.summary: A JPMorgan report states that significant selling from leveraged ETFs contributed to Friday's U.S. stock market selloff. Options dealers were forced to cover market exposure, exacerbating the downturn initially triggered by U.S.-China trade tariff threats. This event highlights the growing interest and potential risks associated with leveraged ETF products, especially as more issuers apply for higher leverage levels on individual stocks.

articles.title: Vertiv Holdings Co. (VRT) Stock: Energizing the Future of AI with NVIDIA and 800 VDC Innovation - parameter.io
articles.summary: Vertiv Holdings Co. (VRT) is advancing its collaboration with NVIDIA to power next-generation AI factories using an 800 VDC power architecture, moving from concept to engineering readiness for large-scale deployment by 2026. This innovative approach redefines data center power distribution, offering greater efficiency, scalability, and stability for demanding AI workloads compared to traditional systems. The 800 VDC architecture reduces conversion losses, minimizes copper usage, and integrates multi-timescale energy storage to manage power fluctuations, reinforcing Vertiv's position in critical AI infrastructure.

articles.title: The AI Arms Race Intensifies: Nvidia, AMD, TSMC, and Samsung Battle for Chip Supremacy - FinancialContent
articles.summary: The article discusses the intensifying competition among Nvidia, AMD, TSMC, and Samsung in the artificial intelligence (AI) chip market. These tech giants are vying for market share and technological supremacy to meet the surging global demand for powerful AI hardware. Their innovations and manufacturing capabilities are central to the future development of AI.

articles.title: Big Money Move: Investment Manager Buys $6.9 Million Worth of Johnson & Johnson Shares, According to Recent Filing
articles.summary: Cyndeo Wealth Partners, LLC reported purchasing 40,238 shares of Johnson & Johnson (JNJ) for an estimated $6.89 million during Q3 2025. This acquisition increased their total JNJ holding to 103,832 shares, valued at $19.25 million, representing 1.07% of their assets under management. The article highlights J&J's strong performance, attractive dividend yield, and relatively affordable valuation despite ongoing litigation risks.

articles.title: Big Money Move: Investment Manager Buys $6.9 Million Worth of Johnson & Johnson Shares, According to Recent Filing
articles.summary: Cyndeo Wealth Partners recently purchased 40,238 shares of Johnson & Johnson (JNJ) valued at approximately $6.89 million, increasing their total holding to $19.25 million. This investment highlights the firm's conviction in JNJ, which has seen strong stock performance, outperforming the S&P 500, despite ongoing litigation risks. The article suggests JNJ could be an attractive option for value-oriented investors due to its dividend yield and P/E ratio.

articles.title: Broadcom Leads 14 Hot Newcomers Onto Best Stock Lists - Investor's Business Daily
articles.summary: Broadcom (AVGO) and Argenx (ARGX) lead 14 new additions to Investor's Business Daily's best stock lists, including the IBD 50, Big Cap 20, and Stock Spotlight. These lists are regularly updated to reflect top-performing stocks and remove those showing weakness. The additions highlight a mix of established leaders and high-performing lesser-known companies.

articles.title: Nvidia and AMD Could Be the Biggest Winners as Start-Ups Like Groq Push AI Chip Demand Higher
articles.summary: The rise of AI start-ups like Groq, a competitor to Nvidia and AMD, is increasing demand for AI-specific chips, particularly for inference tasks. This expanded market benefits industry leaders Nvidia and AMD, who are capitalizing on this shift by offering specialized AI hardware and forming key partnerships, thus strengthening their positions in the evolving AI landscape. While Groq's success creates market diversification and reduces antitrust risks for Nvidia, the established players' financial power allows them to maintain their lead in AI technology development.

articles.title: Navitas (NVTS) Stock Skyrockets on NVIDIA AI Power Deal – 150% YTD, Rally Set to Continue? - ts2.tech
articles.summary: Navitas Semiconductor (NVTS) stock has skyrocketed over 150% year-to-date, driven primarily by a collaboration with NVIDIA to develop 800-volt DC power architecture for AI data centers. Despite its impressive rally and strong technical indicators, the company remains unprofitable, with meaningful revenue from the NVIDIA partnership not expected until 2027. Analysts offer mixed opinions on its future, balancing the significant growth potential in AI with high valuation and intense competition in the power semiconductor market.

articles.title: Nvidia unveils its vision for gigawatt ‘AI factories’ based on its Vera Rubin architecture - SiliconANGLE
articles.summary: Nvidia has unveiled its vision for gigawatt 'AI factories' built upon its upcoming Vera Rubin architecture, set to launch in 2027. This architecture features a central printed circuit board midplane and modular expansion bays for enhanced scalability and easier maintenance. Additionally, Meta Platforms Inc. and Oracle Corp. announced plans to standardize their data centers on Nvidia’s Spectrum-X Ethernet networking switches for immediate performance gains in AI workloads.

articles.title: Nvidia to Start Selling $3,999 DGX Spark Mini PC This Week - PCMag UK
articles.summary: Nvidia is set to begin selling its DGX Spark mini PC, an AI developer-focused device, starting October 15th for $3,999. This 2.6-pound device runs Nvidia's custom DGX OS (Ubuntu Linux) and features a GB10 super chip, 128GB of LPDDR5x memory, and 4TB of NVMe storage, positioning it as a compact AI supercomputer. Nvidia is also preparing to release the more powerful DGX Station later this year with partner support.

articles.title: Nvidia and AMD Could Be the Biggest Winners as Start-Ups Like Groq Push AI Chip Demand Higher - The Motley Fool
articles.summary: The rise of AI startups like Groq is creating increased demand for specialized AI chips, surprisingly benefiting established players Nvidia and AMD. While Groq's LPUs are designed for AI inference, their success is driving the overall market for AI hardware, leading to more sales for Nvidia and AMD. Both industry giants are capitalizing on this growing demand by providing a range of AI-specific processors and securing major deals with companies like OpenAI.

articles.title: AI Supercycle Ignites Semiconductor Sector: Broadcom-OpenAI Deal and Applied Materials Surge Signal New Era - FinancialContent
articles.summary: The AI Supercycle is profoundly reshaping the semiconductor industry, driven by insatiable demand for advanced computing power. Broadcom's strategic partnership with OpenAI for custom AI accelerators and Applied Materials' stock surge due to increased demand for chip fabrication equipment highlight this transformation. The article emphasizes the shift towards specialized silicon solutions, the creation of clear winners and losers in the AI chip race, and the broader significance of AI as a new industrial revolution.

articles.title: Navitas Semiconductor Shares Jump After Hours on New Power Chips for Nvidia AI Platforms - MarketScreener
articles.summary: Navitas Semiconductor's shares rose significantly after hours following the announcement of new power chips designed for Nvidia's AI platforms. The article also mentions other companies collaborating with Nvidia on AI data center power solutions and highlights recent news related to Nvidia, Intel, Broadcom, and OpenAI in the semiconductor and AI infrastructure space.

articles.title: OpenAI’s $2.3trn spending spree is either a house of cards or genius - AFR
articles.summary: OpenAI CEO Sam Altman has orchestrated agreements with Broadcom, AMD, and Nvidia for chip supplies, despite not having secured the $2.3 trillion in funding required for his ambitious AI chip venture. This spending spree is viewed as either a stroke of genius or a precarious house of cards, highlighting the speculative nature of such massive investments in the burgeoning AI sector. The article also touches on general market gremlins and frothy AI valuations.

articles.title: Why have Nvidia and Uber chosen to support this small $900 million AI company? - Bitget
articles.summary: Nvidia and Uber have invested in Serve Robotics, a company specializing in autonomous delivery robots, despite its modest revenue of $1.8 million last year and a $900 million valuation. Uber's involvement originated from its acquisition of Postmates, while Nvidia, after selling its stake for a profit, initially integrated its AI technology into Serve's vehicles. Both companies see potential in Serve's technology, with Uber Eats planning to deploy 2,000 robots by year-end, and DoorDash also signing a multi-year agreement.

articles.title: Navitas Supports 800 VDC Power Architecture for NVIDIA’s Next-Generation AI Factory Computing Platforms
articles.summary: Navitas Semiconductor is supporting NVIDIA's next-generation AI factory computing platforms with its GaNFast and GeneSiC technologies, enabling 800 VDC power architecture. This shift from traditional 54 V in-rack power distribution addresses the power challenges posed by large-scale AI and HPC workloads, offering higher efficiency, scalability, and reliability for data centers. Navitas' advanced GaN and SiC solutions are crucial for achieving the unprecedented power density and efficiency required from the utility grid to the GPU in AI factories.

articles.title: Semiconductor Sector Soars: Broadcom-OpenAI Deal and Applied Materials' Surge Ignite Market Optimism - FinancialContent
articles.summary: The semiconductor sector experienced a significant surge following a multi-billion dollar collaboration between Broadcom and OpenAI for custom AI accelerators and advanced networking systems. This rally was further fueled by Applied Materials' stock jump due to favorable analyst upgrades and strong earnings, underscoring the industry's critical role in the accelerating AI revolution. The events highlight deepened confidence in AI's long-term growth, the importance of custom silicon, and a potential "AI infrastructure arms race."

articles.title: Why Murphy Oil Stock Flew Nearly 8% Higher Today - The Globe and Mail
articles.summary: Murphy Oil's stock rose by nearly 8% today due to two analyst price target raises in recent trading days. Wells Fargo's Roger Read and Bank of Nova Scotia both increased their price targets for the company, citing strong operational and financial results expected for the third quarter. Despite the increases, both analysts maintained a "hold" recommendation on the stock.

articles.title: OpenAI partners with Broadcom to design its own AI chips
articles.summary: OpenAI is partnering with chipmaker Broadcom to design its own artificial intelligence computer chips, with deployment expected late next year. This collaboration is part of OpenAI's broader strategy to secure specialized chips and data center infrastructure for its AI systems, following recent deals with Nvidia and AMD. The move aims to give OpenAI more control over its technological destiny, despite concerns about a potential AI bubble due to its significant commitments compared to current revenue.

articles.title: Asana and Teradata Shares Are Soaring, What You Need To Know
articles.summary: Asana (NYSE:ASAN) and Teradata (NYSE:TDC) shares surged after President Donald Trump's comments eased concerns about escalating trade tensions with China, leading to a broader market rally. This comes after both stocks were negatively impacted by initial tariff threats, with Asana seeing significant volatility. The article highlights the market's overreaction to news as a potential buying opportunity for high-quality stocks.

articles.title: Navitas supports 800 Vdc power architecture for Nvidia's next-generation AI factory computing platforms - MarketScreener
articles.summary: Navitas Semiconductor will support Nvidia's next-generation AI factory computing platforms with its 800 Vdc power architecture. This collaboration highlights the growing importance of advanced power solutions for high-performance AI data centers. The company's innovative SiC and GaN technologies are key to enabling efficient and powerful AI infrastructure.

articles.title: Asana and Teradata Shares Are Soaring, What You Need To Know
articles.summary: Shares of Asana and Teradata rallied following President Trump's eased rhetoric on trade tensions with China, which provided significant relief to investors. This market recovery saw technology stocks like AMD and Nvidia also climb, reversing a sharp sell-off from previous tariff threats. The article highlights the volatility of Asana's shares and its year-to-date performance.

articles.title: Amtech (ASYS) Stock Is Up, What You Need To Know - TradingView
articles.summary: Shares of semiconductor production equipment provider Amtech Systems (ASYS) jumped after President Trump softened his tone on trade relations with China, benefiting the semiconductor sector. This rally comes just days after a significant drop fueled by threats of new tariffs on Chinese goods. Despite the volatility, Amtech's shares are up 72% since the beginning of the year, trading near its 52-week high.

articles.title: ZoomInfo, Upstart, F5, Procore Technologies, and Doximity Shares Skyrocket, What You Need To Know - FinancialContent
articles.summary: Several tech stocks, including ZoomInfo, Upstart, F5, Procore Technologies, and Doximity, saw significant gains after President Trump eased trade tension concerns with China. The market reacted positively to signals that the trade conflict would not escalate, leading to a broad rally in U.S. stocks. Doximity, despite its recent volatility and a JPMorgan downgrade, also experienced a jump, with its shares trading at $67.50, up 26% year-to-date.

articles.title: Amtech (ASYS) Stock Is Up, What You Need To Know - The Globe and Mail
articles.summary: Amtech Systems (ASYS) shares jumped 3.8% after President Trump softened his tone on trade relations with China, easing investor fears in the semiconductor sector. This recovery comes after a significant drop fueled by earlier threats of tariffs on Chinese goods. Despite closing up 4.7% for the day, the stock remains volatile, having risen 72% year-to-date.

articles.title: Meta and Oracle Embrace NVIDIA’s Spectrum-X: Ethernet Enters the Mega AI Factory Era - SiliconANGLE
articles.summary: Meta and Oracle are adopting NVIDIA's Spectrum-X Ethernet networking platform to power their AI-scale computing, transforming data centers into mega AI factories. This move signifies a re-invention of Ethernet for AI workloads, offering significant performance gains and enabling large-scale, distributed AI infrastructure. NVIDIA positions networking as the new operating system for AI factories, underscoring its critical role in the industrialization of AI.

articles.title: Power Integrations has secured a partnership with Nvidia to build its next-generation power delivery systems for AI data centers - CryptoRank
articles.summary: Power Integrations and Nvidia have partnered to develop next-generation power delivery systems for AI data centers, specifically focusing on Nvidia's initiative to convert facilities to 800 volts of direct current (VDC). Power Integrations will supply high-efficiency gallium nitride (GaN) components, including 1200V and 1700V PowiGaN chips, designed to reduce power loss and improve energy efficiency. The announcement led to a significant surge in Power Integrations' stock by over 18%.

articles.title: Power Integrations joins work with Nvidia on power supply push - 104.1 WIKY
articles.summary: Power Integrations announced its collaboration with Nvidia to advance high-voltage power supply technology for AI data centers. The partnership aims to transition data centers to 800-volt direct current to enhance efficiency. Power Integrations will supply gallium nitride (GaN) chips, leveraging its automotive qualification for reliability.

articles.title: Why AMD Shares Are Trading Higher on Monday?
articles.summary: Advanced Micro Devices (AMD) shares rose on Monday after several brokerages upgraded their outlooks due to optimism regarding AMD's expanding role in artificial intelligence. KGI Securities, Bank of America, and Mizuho reiterated bullish views, raising price targets and citing strengthening demand for AMD's AI chips and new data center partnerships, including a collaboration with OpenAI. AMD shares have seen significant gains year-to-date and over the past year, driven by strong AI chip demand and positive analyst sentiment.

articles.title: Tracy Shuchart: JPMorgan Chase launches $1.5 trillion initiative - Traders Union
articles.summary: JPMorgan Chase has announced a $1.5 trillion Security and Resiliency Initiative aimed at strengthening critical industries. This ambitious plan is highlighted by industry observer Tracy Shuchart, who emphasizes its importance in the current global economic environment. The initiative underscores a broader industry shift toward strategic investment and collaboration.

articles.title: AMD Shares Rise 33% in a Month: Buy, Sell or Hold the Stock?
articles.summary: AMD shares have risen 33% in the last month due to strong demand for EPYC processors and Instinct accelerators, especially in AI infrastructure. The company provided a positive Q3 guidance, expecting significant revenue growth. However, AMD faces stiff competition from NVIDIA and Broadcom and its stock is currently considered overvalued, leading to a "Hold" rating from Zacks.

articles.title: Why Hasbro (HAS) Could Beat Earnings Estimates Again - sharewise.com
articles.summary: Hasbro (HAS) is positioned to potentially beat earnings estimates again, driven by its positive Earnings ESP of +1.21% and a Zacks Rank #3 (Hold). The company has a strong track record of beating earnings estimates, with an average surprise of 60.95% over the past two quarters. Investors are looking forward to its next earnings report on October 23, 2025.

articles.title: Navitas Supports 800 VDC Power Architecture for NVIDIA’s Next-Generation AI Factory Computing Platforms - The Manila Times
articles.summary: Navitas Semiconductor is supporting NVIDIA's next-generation AI factory computing platforms with its GaN and SiC power semiconductors, enabling the transition to 800 VDC power architectures. This collaboration aims to enhance power delivery efficiency and density for GPUs and AI data centers. The partnership leverages Navitas's advancements in high-voltage power conversion to meet the demanding requirements of AI infrastructure.

articles.title: Navitas Semiconductor Advances 800 VDC Power Solutions for Next-Generation AI Data Centers - Quiver Quantitative
articles.summary: Navitas Semiconductor is developing advanced 800 VDC GaN and SiC power devices to support NVIDIA's next-generation AI factory computing platforms, addressing the significant power challenges of high-density AI data centers. The new 800 VDC architecture improves efficiency, scalability, and reliability by reducing power losses and streamlining conversion from utility power to IT racks. Navitas' GaNFast and GeneSiC technologies, including new 100 V GaN FETs and 650 V GaN devices with GaNSafe™ technology, are designed to power every stage of the AI data center from grid to GPU.

articles.title: Navitas stock soars as company advances 800V tech for NVIDIA AI platforms By Investing.com - Investing.com South Africa
articles.summary: The provided article content indicates an application error, and therefore, no actual news content about Navitas's stock performance or technological advancements is available. The title suggests Navitas stock soared due to its 800V technology being advanced for NVIDIA AI platforms, but this information is not present in the article body.

articles.title: Nilsine Partners Boosts Stake in QQXT as Investors Look Beyond Big Tech - Mitrade
articles.summary: Nilsine Partners, LLC increased its stake in the First Trust NASDAQ-100 Ex-Technology Sector Index Fund (QQXT) by purchasing 61,385 shares, valued at approximately $6.07 million. This move signals confidence in large-cap U.S. stocks outside the technology sector and diversifies the firm's portfolio by giving equal weight to sectors like consumer goods, healthcare, and industrials. The ETF, QQXT, tracks the NASDAQ-100 Ex-Technology Sector Index, offering investors exposure to U.S. equities without heavy reliance on big tech.

articles.title: Navitas stock soars as company advances 800V tech for NVIDIA AI platforms - Investing.com
articles.summary: This article indicates that Navitas stock surged due to the company's progress in 800V technology for NVIDIA AI platforms. However, the full content of the article is unavailable, showing an application error. Thus, further details about the advancement and its specific impact on the stock are not provided.

articles.title: Why Is Oracle (ORCL) Stock Rocketing Higher Today
articles.summary: Oracle's stock jumped 5.4% following strategic partnerships with Zoom Communications to enhance cloud offerings and Duality for encrypted data collaboration. The company also announced using Nvidia's advanced Ethernet switches for its AI factories, signaling a strong focus on AI infrastructure. This positive momentum was further buoyed by easing U.S.-China trade tensions and recent analyst optimism regarding Oracle's AI growth.

articles.title: Why Is Oracle (ORCL) Stock Rocketing Higher Today - FinancialContent
articles.summary: Oracle (ORCL) stock jumped 5.4% due to strategic partnerships with Zoom Communications for cloud offerings and Duality for encrypted data collaboration. The company's focus on AI infrastructure was highlighted by using Nvidia's advanced Ethernet switches in its AI factories, leading to strong demand for its AI services. This positive momentum was further boosted by easing U.S.-China trade tensions.
